doc.previous: In the first group of examples let u be an unknown function of x and c and are known constants  Linear differential equations frequently appear as approximations to nonlinear equations These approximations are only valid under restricted conditions For example the harmonic oscillator equation is an approximation to the nonlinear pendulum equation that is valid for small amplitude oscillations see below
